title: Mobile Application Design for Children's Education: ADDIE Model-Based Teaching Method Development

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theories and understanding of mobile application development processes
context.additional_context: Language education domain application for working professionals, emphasizing practice in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can write a design document for a mobile application for children by utilizing the five phases of the ADDIE model (Analysis-Design-Development-Implementation-Evaluation).

Learners can produce interactive storyboards integrating exaggerated animation elements (e.g., character proportions, color contrast) and touch gestures suitable for childrenâ€™s cognitive development stages.
Referencing prior case studies (MFolktales), learners can develop educational content prototypes reflecting sociocultural values and collect test feedback in VR simulation environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
